name: py-pyomo

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

description:
Pyomo is a Python-based open-source software package that supports a
diverse set of optimization capabilities for formulating and analyzing
optimization models.

dependencies.name: python
dependencies.description: The Python programming language.

dependencies.name: py-pip
dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-wheel
dependencies.description: A built-package format for Python.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-ply
dependencies.description: Python Lex & Yacc.

dependencies.name: py-pyutilib
dependencies.description:
The PyUtilib project supports a collection of Python utilities,
including a well-developed component architecture and extensions to the
PyUnit testing framework. PyUtilib has been developed to support several
Python-centric projects, especially Pyomo. PyUtilib is available under
the BSD License.

dependencies.name: py-six
dependencies.description: Python 2 and 3 compatibility utilities.

dependencies.name: py-appdirs
dependencies.description:
A small Python module for determining appropriate platform-specific
dirs, e.g. a "user data dir".

dependencies.name: py-cython
dependencies.description: The Cython compiler for writing C extensions for the Python language.

dependencies.name: py-coverage
dependencies.description: Testing coverage checker for python

dependencies.name: py-nose
dependencies.description:
nose extends the test loading and running features of unittest, making
it easier to write, find and run tests.

dependencies.name: py-pytest
dependencies.description: pytest: simple powerful testing with Python.

dependencies.name: py-pytest-parallel
dependencies.description: A pytest plugin for parallel and concurrent testing.

dependencies.name: py-parameterized
dependencies.description: Parameterized testing with any Python test framework.

dependencies.name: py-pybind11
dependencies.description:
pybind11 -- Seamless operability between C++11 and Python. pybind11 is a
lightweight header-only library that exposes C++ types in Python and
vice versa, mainly to create Python bindings of existing C++ code. Its
goals and syntax are similar to the excellent Boost.Python library by
David Abrahams: to minimize boilerplate code in traditional extension
modules by inferring type information using compile-time introspection.

dependencies.name: py-sphinx
dependencies.description: Sphinx Documentation Generator.

dependencies.name: py-sphinx-copybutton
dependencies.description: A small sphinx extension to add a "copy" button to code blocks.

dependencies.name: py-sphinx-rtd-theme
dependencies.description: ReadTheDocs.org theme for Sphinx.

dependencies.name: py-sphinxcontrib-jsmath
dependencies.description: A sphinx extension which renders display math in HTML via JavaScript.

dependencies.name: py-sphinxcontrib-napoleon
dependencies.description: Sphinx "napoleon" extension.

dependencies.name: py-numpy
dependencies.description: Fundamental package for array computing in Python.

dependencies.name: py-scipy
dependencies.description: Fundamental algorithms for scientific computing in Python.

dependencies.name: py-dill
dependencies.description: Serialize all of python

dependencies.name: py-ipython
dependencies.description:
IPython provides a rich toolkit to help you make the most out of using
Python interactively.

dependencies.name: py-matplotlib
dependencies.description:
Matplotlib is a comprehensive library for creating static, animated, and
interactive visualizations in Python.

dependencies.name: py-networkx
dependencies.description:
NetworkX is a Python package for the creation, manipulation, and study
of the structure, dynamics, and functions of complex networks.

dependencies.name: py-openpyxl
dependencies.description: A Python library to read/write Excel 2010 xlsx/xlsm files

dependencies.name: py-pint
dependencies.description:
Pint is a Python package to define, operate and manipulate physical
quantities: the product of a numerical value and a unit of measurement.
It allows arithmetic operations between them and conversions from and to
different units.

dependencies.name: py-plotly
dependencies.description: An interactive, browser-based graphing library for Python

dependencies.name: py-python-louvain
dependencies.description:
This module implements community detection. It uses the louvain method
described in Fast unfolding of communities in large networks, Vincent D
Blondel, Jean-Loup Guillaume, Renaud Lambiotte, Renaud Lefebvre, Journal
of Statistical Mechanics: Theory and Experiment 2008(10), P10008 (12pp)

dependencies.name: py-pyyaml
dependencies.description: PyYAML is a YAML parser and emitter for Python.

dependencies.name: py-sympy
dependencies.description: SymPy is a Python library for symbolic mathematics.

dependencies.name: py-xlrd
dependencies.description:
Library for developers to extract data from Microsoft Excel (tm)
spreadsheet files

dependencies.name: py-z3-solver
dependencies.description:
Z3 is a theorem prover from Microsoft Research. It is licensed under the
MIT license.

dependencies.name: py-pywin32
dependencies.description: Python for Window Extensions.

dependencies.name: py-casadi
dependencies.description:
CasADi -- framework for algorithmic differentiation and numeric
optimization

dependencies.name: py-numdifftools
dependencies.description:
Solves automatic numerical differentiation problems in one or more
variables.

dependencies.name: py-pandas
dependencies.description:
pandas is a fast, powerful, flexible and easy to use open source data
analysis and manipulation tool, built on top of the Python programming
language.

dependencies.name: py-seaborn
dependencies.description:
Seaborn: statistical data visualization. Seaborn is a library for making
attractive and informative statistical graphics in Python. It is built
on top of matplotlib and tightly integrated with the PyData stack,
including support for numpy and pandas data structures and statistical
routines from scipy and statsmodels.
